meanings.definition: To strike with an open hand.
meanings.sent1: She slapped the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: He slapped the mosquito on his arm.
meanings.sent3: The wind slapped the flag against the pole, making a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The news of the scandal slapped him in the face.
meanings.sent5: The chef slapped the dough to flatten it for the pizza.

meanings.definition: To put or place quickly or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She slapped the book on the table and rushed out.
meanings.sent2: He slapped the cup on the coaster to avoid spills.
meanings.sent3: The teacher slapped the test papers on the desk, surprising the students.
meanings.sent4: The storm slapped the leaves against the window.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic slapped the new tire on the car in record time.

meanings.sent1: The news of the accident slapped her with sadness.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected promotion slapped him with joy.
meanings.sent3: The sudden rain slapped the picnic plans, but they had fun indoors.
meanings.sent4: The realization of his mistake slapped him with regret.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise of the firecracker slapped the silence of the night.
